pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw: Since the publishers are already throttled by `ign-transport` through `AdvertiseMessageOptions`, maybe we can check [Publisher::UpateThrottling](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/src/aeb86d615f4b50f2a2e09ec3e08c52ac1a9c5b09/include/ignition/transport/Node.hh#lines-148) instead?
content.html: Since the publishers are already throttled by ign-transport through AdvertiseMessageOptions, maybe we can check Publisher::UpateThrottling instead?

pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw: does this break ABI?
content.html: does this break ABI?

pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw:
Oh for sure.  I should have been more clear.  Addisu and I were doing some pair programming this afternoon, and these were some optimizations that we came up with.  I haven’t gone back to figure out if we can do it in a non-abi breaking way yet. 

Maybe we can keep the UpdateFromECM for ABI, but add two new methods that the rendering system can use, because I’m essentially splitting the functionality of create/remove and the actual update pass.
content.html:
Oh for sure. I should have been more clear. Addisu and I were doing some pair programming this afternoon, and these were some optimizations that we came up with. I haven’t gone back to figure out if we can do it in a non-abi breaking way yet.

Maybe we can keep the UpdateFromECM for ABI, but add two new methods that the rendering system can use, because I’m essentially splitting the functionality of create/remove and the actual update pass.

pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw: Adding a new function doesn't break ABI, right?
content.html: Adding a new function doesn't break ABI, right?

pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw: Ohh I see. You fixed it after Ian's comment.
content.html: Ohh I see. You fixed it after Ian's comment.

pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw: Adding the default argument could potentially cause problems based on this reference: [https://community.kde.org/Policies/Binary\_Compatibility\_Issues\_With\_C%2B%2B](https://community.kde.org/Policies/Binary_Compatibility_Issues_With_C%2B%2B), so I walked that back for now and just went with adding a new overload with three arguments.  We can tick-tock the default argument in.
content.html: Adding the default argument could potentially cause problems based on this reference: https://community.kde.org/Policies/Binary_Compatibility_Issues_With_C%2B%2B, so I walked that back for now and just went with adding a new overload with three arguments. We can tick-tock the default argument in.

pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw:
Logs subscribe to dynamic pose updates so I'm not sure using system clock, instead of using sim time, is the right thing. I thought it was fine for static poses, but I just saw that the comms broker uses that topic, so now I'm not sure if it's a good idea for static poses either.

I know we brought this up before, I don't know if we addressed it conclusively.
content.html:
Logs subscribe to dynamic pose updates so I'm not sure using system clock, instead of using sim time, is the right thing. I thought it was fine for static poses, but I just saw that the comms broker uses that topic, so now I'm not sure if it's a good idea for static poses either.

I know we brought this up before, I don't know if we addressed it conclusively.

pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw:
That's a very good point. I think throttling should be made based on sim time for consistency across systems.

In that case, the ign-transport update won't help, sorry @{carromj} :sweat:
content.html:
That's a very good point. I think throttling should be made based on sim time for consistency across systems.

In that case, the ign-transport update won't help, sorry @Michael Carroll

content.raw: If we're afraid of merging this into `ign-gazebo2` and having adverse effects on Blueprint, how about retargeting to `default`? Then we can close this PR, and we can always backport it to Blueprint in the future if it's proven to work well on Citadel.

pullrequest.title: Performance: Throttle the SceneBroadcaster and render systems

content.raw: I just went over this PR again and it still looks good to me. I actually think it's an improvement over the current behaviour, because now the pose publisher is throttled according to sim time. @{557058:65740f22-cc56-4418-9608-7e17d0ed47b7} , do you think you could retarget to `default`?
content.html: I just went over this PR again and it still looks good to me. I actually think it's an improvement over the current behaviour, because now the pose publisher is throttled according to sim time. @Michael Carroll , do you think you could retarget to default?
